command.name: snake
command.help: Create a snake from either one or two sources
command.description: Creates the internal loops needed to snake frames from a tester through the system and back to the tester. Allows one to test traffic on all ports without having testers connected to all ports. For each port on the snake port list, the ports must either be cabled to another port in the list, have a loopback attached to it or have the internal serdes loopback enabled. The command will detect how the ports are externally connected and alter the internal loop structure accordingly to build the longest possible snake. If the external connectivity of a snake port cannot be detected, then that port is left out of the snake. The L3 snake assumes that the tester is sending all traffic to the router MAC 00:0a:00:01:02:03. Additionally, the snake will only route frames inside the 192.*.*.* subnet.
